message.content:
First, we need to calculate the Quick Ratio using the formula:

  Quick Ratio = (Cash on Hand + Bank Deposits + Interest Receivable + Accounts Receivable) / Total Current Liabilities

From the balance sheet:
• Cash on Hand = 927447.32  
• Bank Deposits = 71662.08  
• Interest Receivable = 5264.70  
• Accounts Receivable = 248540.09

Sum the quick assets:  
927447.32 + 71662.08 = 999109.40  
Add Interest Receivable: 999109.40 + 5264.70 = 1004374.10  
Add Accounts Receivable: 1004374.10 + 248540.09 = 1252914.19

Total Current Liabilities = 3389719.66

Thus, the Quick Ratio = 1252914.19 / 3389719.66 ≈ 0.37

Next, the Net Profit Margin is calculated using:

  Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%

From the income statement:
• Net Profit = 111731.83  
• Total Revenue = 791992.51

So,  
Net Profit Margin = (111731.83 / 791992.51) × 100% ≈ 14.11%

Now, the answer in the required format is:

{
  "solution": {"Quick Ratio": "0.37", "Net Profit Margin": "14.11%"}
}
